title: English Grammar Essentials
content:
# English Grammar Essentials

## Parts of Speech

### 1. Noun
A word that names a person, place, thing, or idea.

**Types:**
- **Common**: book, city, dog
- **Proper**: India, John, Amazon
- **Collective**: team, flock, crowd
- **Abstract**: love, happiness, freedom

### 2. Pronoun
Replaces a noun.

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Personal | I, you, he, she, it, we, they |
| Possessive | mine, yours, his, hers, ours |
| Reflexive | myself, yourself, himself |
| Relative | who, which, that, whose |
| Demonstrative | this, that, these, those |

### 3. Verb
Expresses action or state of being.

**Types:**
- **Main verb**: run, eat, think
- **Auxiliary**: is, am, are, was, were, have, has, had
- **Modal**: can, could, may, might, shall, should, will, would, must

### 4. Adjective
Describes a noun.

**Examples:** beautiful, tall, quick, five, this

### 5. Adverb
Modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb.

**Examples:** quickly, very, well, always, never

### 6. Preposition
Shows relationship between words.

**Examples:** in, on, at, by, for, with, to, from

### 7. Conjunction
Connects words or sentences.

**Types:**
- **Coordinating**: and, but, or, nor, for, yet, so (FANBOYS)
- **Subordinating**: because, although, if, when, while

### 8. Interjection
Expresses emotion.

**Examples:** Oh!, Wow!, Alas!, Hurrah!

## Tenses

### Present Tense
| Type | Structure | Example |
|------|-----------|----------|
| Simple | V1/V1+s | He plays. |
| Continuous | is/am/are + V-ing | He is playing. |
| Perfect | has/have + V3 | He has played. |
| Perfect Continuous | has/have been + V-ing | He has been playing. |

### Past Tense
| Type | Structure | Example |
|------|-----------|----------|
| Simple | V2 | He played. |
| Continuous | was/were + V-ing | He was playing. |
| Perfect | had + V3 | He had played. |
| Perfect Continuous | had been + V-ing | He had been playing. |

### Future Tense
| Type | Structure | Example |
|------|-----------|----------|
| Simple | will + V1 | He will play. |
| Continuous | will be + V-ing | He will be playing. |
| Perfect | will have + V3 | He will have played. |
| Perfect Continuous | will have been + V-ing | He will have been playing. |

## Subject-Verb Agreement Rules

1. Singular subject → Singular verb
2. Plural subject → Plural verb
3. "Neither...nor", "Either...or" → Verb agrees with nearest subject
4. Collective nouns → Usually singular verb
5. "Each", "Every", "Everyone" → Singular verb

title: Important Vocabulary
content:
# Important Vocabulary

## Synonyms (Similar Meaning)

| Word | Synonyms |
|------|----------|
| Beautiful | Gorgeous, Stunning, Lovely |
| Big | Large, Huge, Enormous, Massive |
| Small | Tiny, Little, Minute, Miniature |
| Happy | Joyful, Delighted, Pleased, Glad |
| Sad | Unhappy, Sorrowful, Melancholy |
| Fast | Quick, Rapid, Swift, Speedy |
| Slow | Sluggish, Leisurely, Gradual |
| Smart | Intelligent, Clever, Brilliant |
| Brave | Courageous, Fearless, Bold |
| Angry | Furious, Irate, Enraged |

## Antonyms (Opposite Meaning)

| Word | Antonym |
|------|----------|
| Accept | Reject |
| Ancient | Modern |
| Arrival | Departure |
| Abundant | Scarce |
| Benevolent | Malevolent |
| Bold | Timid |
| Captivity | Freedom |
| Defend | Attack |
| Expand | Contract |
| Generous | Stingy |

## One Word Substitution

| Description | One Word |
|-------------|----------|
| One who loves books | Bibliophile |
| One who hates mankind | Misanthropist |
| One who loves mankind | Philanthropist |
| One who can use both hands | Ambidextrous |
| One who cannot be corrected | Incorrigible |
| Government by the rich | Plutocracy |
| Government by one person | Autocracy |
| Government by the people | Democracy |
| One who knows many languages | Polyglot |
| Fear of heights | Acrophobia |
| Fear of water | Hydrophobia |
| Fear of closed spaces | Claustrophobia |
| Murder of a king | Regicide |
| Murder of one's father | Patricide |
| Murder of one's mother | Matricide |
| Study of birds | Ornithology |
| Study of insects | Entomology |
| Study of earthquakes | Seismology |

## Common Confusables

| Words | Difference |
|-------|------------|
| Accept/Except | Accept = receive; Except = excluding |
| Affect/Effect | Affect = verb; Effect = noun |
| Advice/Advise | Advice = noun; Advise = verb |
| Compliment/Complement | Compliment = praise; Complement = complete |
| Stationary/Stationery | Stationary = not moving; Stationery = writing materials |
| Principal/Principle | Principal = chief/head; Principle = rule |
| Loose/Lose | Loose = not tight; Lose = misplace |
| Their/There/They're | Their = possessive; There = place; They're = they are |

title: Common Idioms and Phrases
content:
# Common Idioms and Phrases

## Popular Idioms

| Idiom | Meaning |
|-------|----------|
| A piece of cake | Very easy |
| Break the ice | Start a conversation |
| Hit the nail on the head | Be exactly right |
| Once in a blue moon | Very rarely |
| Under the weather | Feeling ill |
| Cost an arm and a leg | Very expensive |
| Bite the bullet | Face a difficult situation |
| Let the cat out of the bag | Reveal a secret |
| Burning the midnight oil | Working late into the night |
| A blessing in disguise | Good thing that seemed bad initially |
| Beat around the bush | Avoid the main topic |
| Kill two birds with one stone | Achieve two things with one action |
| The ball is in your court | It's your decision |
| Speak of the devil | Said when person you're talking about appears |
| See eye to eye | Agree completely |
| Spill the beans | Reveal secret information |
| Add fuel to the fire | Make situation worse |
| At the drop of a hat | Immediately, without hesitation |
| Back to square one | Start over |
| Barking up the wrong tree | Looking in wrong place |

## Phrases with Meanings

| Phrase | Meaning |
|--------|----------|
| In the nick of time | Just in time |
| At the eleventh hour | At the last moment |
| By hook or by crook | By any means |
| A man of letters | A scholar |
| A man of straw | A weak person |
| Black sheep | Disgraceful member |
| Blue blood | Noble birth |
| A red letter day | Important day |
| Green room | Actors' waiting room |
| White elephant | Expensive but useless |
| To turn over a new leaf | Start fresh |
| To keep one's fingers crossed | Hope for best |
| To have a green thumb | Good at gardening |
| To be in hot water | Be in trouble |
| To cry over spilt milk | Regret what can't be changed |

## Proverbs

| Proverb | Meaning |
|---------|----------|
| A stitch in time saves nine | Act early to prevent problems |
| Rome wasn't built in a day | Important work takes time |
| When in Rome, do as Romans do | Adapt to local customs |
| Don't count your chickens before they hatch | Don't assume success too early |
| Actions speak louder than words | What you do matters more than what you say |
| The early bird catches the worm | Success comes to those who start early |
| Too many cooks spoil the broth | Too many people ruin a project |
| Look before you leap | Think before acting |
| All that glitters is not gold | Appearances can be deceptive |
